law.text: To protect public health, safety, welfare, and morals, and to the extent allowed under North Carolina law, the following privilege license provisions and regulations are ordained for the privilege of carrying on the business, trade, or profession of massagist and for the operation or carrying on of the businesses, trades, or professions commonly known as massage parlors, health salons, physical culture studios, or similar establishments by whatever name designated, wherein massage or other physical manipulation of the human body is carried on or practiced. (Code 1959 , ยง14-200; Ord. No. 2001-935, ยง1, 2-6-01) Cross reference: Massage of private parts of another, ยง13-3006
